Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ShapeLocks.NoTextEdit attribute is not working in PowerPoint presentation" (#444) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**ShapeLocks.NoTextEdit attribute is not working in PowerPoint presentation**

Reference : https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/office/en-US/c1c61293-72b9-4dc5-ae65-8d5a46144003/shapelocksnotextedit-attribute-is-not-working-in-powerpoint-presentation-2016?forum=oxmlsdk

I am trying to protect a text box in a PowerPoint slide by making it as non-editable. I am editing the XML file as below (Please see the attribute highlighted in bold).

I referred this [documentation](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/documentformat.openxml.drawing.shapelocks.notextedit?cs-save-lang=1&cs-lang=csharp)

The below XML is valid. I have edited the XML with just an text editor by unzipping the PPTX file.

`<p:spTree>
      <p:nvGrpSpPr>
        <p:cNvPr id="1" name="" />
        <p:cNvGrpSpPr />
        <p:nvPr />
      </p:nvGrpSpPr>
      <p:grpSpPr>
        <a:xfrm/>        
      </p:grpSpPr>
      <p:sp>
        <p:nvSpPr>
          <p:cNvPr id="4" name="TextBox 3"/>
          <p:cNvSpPr txBox="1">
            <a:spLocks noSelect="1" noTextEdit = "1"/>
          </p:cNvSpPr>
          <p:nvPr />
        </p:nvSpPr>
        <p:spPr>
          <a:xfrm>
            <a:off x="3179298" y="1519311" />
            <a:ext cx="4937760" cy="369332" />
          </a:xfrm>
          <a:prstGeom prst="rect">
            <a:avLst />
          </a:prstGeom>
          <a:noFill />
        </p:spPr>
        <p:txBody>
          <a:bodyPr wrap="square" rtlCol="0">
            <a:spAutoFit />
          </a:bodyPr>
          <a:lstStyle />
          <a:p>
            <a:r>
              <a:rPr lang="en-US" />
              <a:t>Safvfmple</a:t>
            </a:r>
            <a:endParaRPr lang="en-US" dirty="0" />
          </a:p>
        </p:txBody>
      </p:sp>
    </p:spTree>`

**Expected**
The 'noTextEdit' attribute should work as expected.
Thanks,
Meikandan

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add gfxdata attribute " (#710) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
add gfxdata attribue to Arc, Curve, Line, PolyLine, Group, Image, Oval, Rect, and RoundRect shape complex types per MS-OI29500 2.1.1783-1799

Fixes #709

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Schema Error : The 'urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office:gfxdata' attribute is not declared." (#709) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Is this a:
- [X] Issue with the OpenXml library
- [ ] Question on library usage

**Description**

Schema Error : The 'urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office:gfxdata' attribute is not declared. On 2 separate valid Office 365 Word documents.

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET 4.6.2
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.10.1

**Repro**

Validate the attached file with a WordDocumentValidator.

**Observed**

The following validation error was reported.

Schema Error : The 'urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office:gfxdata' attribute is not declared.

**Expected**

The file should have been validated successfully without errors.
[gfxdata.docx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/4383497/gfxdata.docx)
